intro: Brunellia sibundoya, commonly known as the Sibundoy balsa, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Andean region of South America, particularly found in Ecuador and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and produces showy, yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. The wood of Brunellia sibundoya is lightweight and historically used for making canoes and other crafts.
